Package ohos.ivihardware.advancedmanager

Class HUDManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.ivihardware.advancedmanager.HUDManager

  • public class HUDManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides methods for obtaining, setting, subscribing to, and unsubscribing from the head-up display (HUD) state, height, brightness, snow mode state, and display mode.
    Since:
    5
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Ivi.VehicleControl

      • isHUDActive

        public boolean isHUDActive​()
                    throws ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                           java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Checks whether HUD is enabled.
        Returns:
        Returns true if HUD is enabled; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable.
        Since:
        5

      • enableHUD

        public void enableHUD​(boolean value)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                      ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                      java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Sets whether to enable HUD.
        Parameters:
        value - Specifies whether to enable HUD. The value true means to enable HUD, and false means to disable it.
        Throws:
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if a parameter value is invalid.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable.
        Since:
        5

      • subscribeHUDActiveState

        public void subscribeHUDActiveState​(IntNoZoneSubscribeCallback callback)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                    ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                    java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Subscribes to the HUD state.

        Sample code: 

         
 private class HUDIntCallback extends IntNoZoneSubscribeCallback {

     @Override
     public void onChangeIntSignal(int value) {
     }

     @Override
     public void onErrorIntSignal() {
     }
 }

 HUDIntCallback hudIntCallback = new HUDIntCallback();
 try {
     hudManager.subscribeHUDActiveState(hudIntCallback);
 } catch (RemoteException | UnsupportedOperationException exception) {
     exception.printStackTrace();
 }
        *
        Parameters:
        callback - Indicates the callback to be invoked to perform a specific operation when the HUD state changes. You can implement this callback for your application.
        Throws:
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if a parameter value is invalid.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable.
        Since:
        5

      • unsubscribeHUDActiveState

        public void unsubscribeHUDActiveState​()
                               throws ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                      java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Unsubscribes from the HUD state.
        Throws:

        Since:

      • getHUDHeight

        public int getHUDHeight​()
                 throws ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Obtains the HUD height.
        Returns:
        Returns the HUD height, which ranges from 0 to 31.
        Throws:
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable.
        Since:
        5

      • setHUDBrightness

        public void setHUDBrightness​(int value)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                             ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                             java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Sets the HUD brightness.

        This method is for manual adjustment of the HUD brightness.

        Parameters:
        value - Indicates the HUD brightness. The value ranges from 0 to 31.
        Throws:
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if a parameter value is invalid.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable.
        Since:
        5

      • isHUDSnowModeActive

        public boolean isHUDSnowModeActive​()
                            throws ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                   java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Checks whether the HUD snow mode is enabled.

        If the snow mode is enabled, the color tone of the HUD adapts to driving in the snow.

        Returns:
        Returns true if the HUD snow mode is enabled; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable.
        Since:
        5

      • enableHUDSnowMode

        public void enableHUDSnowMode​(boolean value)
                       throws ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                              java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Sets whether to enable the HUD snow mode.

        If the snow mode is enabled, the color tone of the HUD adapts to driving in the snow.

        Parameters:
        value - Specifies whether to enable the HUD snow mode. The value true means to enable the HUD snow mode, and false means to disable it.
        Throws:
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable.
        Since:
        5

      • subscribeHUDSnowModeState

        public void subscribeHUDSnowModeState​(IntNoZoneSubscribeCallback callback)
                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                      ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                                      java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Subscribes to the HUD snow mode state.
        Parameters:
        callback - Indicates the callback to be invoked to perform a specific operation when the state of the HUD snow mode changes. You can implement this callback for your application.
        Throws:
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if a parameter value is invalid.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable.
        Since:
        5

      • getHUDDisplayMode

        public int getHUDDisplayMode​()
                      throws ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                             java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Obtains the HUD display mode.
        Returns:
        Returns 0 if the HUD works in classic mode; returns 1 if the HUD works in minimalist mode.
        Throws:
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable.
        Since:
        5

      • setHUDDisplayMode

        public void setHUDDisplayMode​(int value)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                              ohos.rpc.RemoteException,
                              java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
        Sets the HUD display mode.
        Parameters:
        value - Indicates the HUD display mode. The value 0 indicates the classic mode, and 1 indicates the minimalist mode.
        Throws:
        ohos.rpc.RemoteException - Throws this exception if an IPC error occurs.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if a parameter value is invalid.
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - Throws this exception if the signal is unavailable.
        Since:
